description.narrative: The proposed project will contribute to increasing the knowledge and technical expertise in water resources, which is the basis for long-term sustainable management, famine combat and economic growth in the Sahel. In the project, natural scientific experiments will be performed using computational technology and a participatory model-development approach for the Niger River, with specific focus on local needs for water exploitation and management in Mali and Burkina Faso. The aim of the project is to define and quantify the dominant hydrological processes in the Niger River basin, to provide a predictive tool and climate change information for water management, and finally, to explore how information access can reduce vulnerability. Participative workshops with end-users will be arranged for dialogues and research on resilience building in the region.
